text:
This is a 59 year-old morbidly obese female with a history of chronic
   left knee pain presented for elective total left knee replacement.
   Intaop stable blood pressure and <200cc blood loss. Post op patient
   extubated, complained of pain, was given morphine, developed
   hypotension and apnea and had to be reintubated and fluid resucitated
   wih 7-8 L fluid. Report that there was some component of obstruction.
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Pt transferred awake, responsive to voice, mouthing words, nodding yes
   to pain, anxious, PIP pressures high, pt with chronic back and knee
   pain prior to surgery, pt also with hx of anxiety
   Action:
   Pt started on propofol gtt, started on fent IV prn and oxycodone prn
   Response:
   Pt
s pain poorly controlled, increased fent IV prn, responded well to
   increase in fent, now comfortable on current sedation and pain regiment
   Plan:
   Pt likely to be extubated tomorrow, will need to readdress pain control
   once extubated, ?pain service consult given pt
s chronic pain issues,
   pt had been transiently on a PCA prior to reintubation
   Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA)
   Assessment:
   In PACU following adm of pain medications, pt unable to maintain airway
   d/t likely obstruction, unable to be maintained on bipap so reintubated
   as noted above, pt with clear breath sounds dim at bases, remained
   mechanically vented throughout the night, initially acidotic
   Action:
   Several vent changes overnight in response to ABGs, trending ABGs
   throughout the shift see flowsheet for data
   Response:
   Last ABG 7.41/44/112/29/2
   Plan:
   Plan to extubate this morning
   [**Last Name 19**] Problem - [**Name (NI) 20**] Description In Comments
   Assessment:
   Pt with Left total knee as noted above, pt presented with knee in CPM
   to 90 degrees,  per surgery to place in immobilizer for night upon
   arrival, hemovac drain from site unclamped at 2200
   Action:
   Surgical dsg intact, immobilizer applied with difficulty d/t pt size,
   attempted ordering larger immobilizer, none available, hemovac draining
   sanginous drainage for a total of 220 cc, pt received 2 units of PRBC
   for a post-op hct of 26.7, repeat hct sent post transfusion
   Response:
   Post transfusion gtt 26.9, HO aware, paging surgery for recs
   Plan:
   ?repeat transfusion, pt to be placed back on CPM on days, continue to
   monitor, f/u surgery recs
